page.title: 13Matlock Bath and area
page.content: {Matlock Bath}has grown up on the west side of a deep limestone gorge.On the east side is a belt of deciduous wood- land then the gorge side rises almost sheer to 350 feet.The beautiful scenery has led to Matlock Bath being called{Little Switzerland}and devel- oping into a tourist area.The sur- rounding countryside is mainly grass- land,deciduous woodland and scrubland. There are many footpaths in this area. {Starkholmes}is a village on the hill- side to the east of Matlock Bath.To the north of Starkholmes is a small residential area at Matlock Green.To the west is the small village of Bonsall.The houses are mainly built of gritstone or limestone.The fields are divided by dry-stone walls of lime- stone or gritstone.Matlock Bath is known as one of the most beautiful areas in the U.K.
